div.p: dr0wned Cyber-Physical Attack with Additive Manufacturing
Sofia Belikovetsky Ben-Gurion University of the Negev
Mark Yampolskiy University of South Alabama
Jinghui Toh Singapore University of Technology and Design
Jacob Gatlin University of South Alabama
Yuval Elovici Ben-Gurion University of the Negev,
Singapore University of Technology and Design
Agenda o Introduction oManufacturing process oThe attack Goal of attack Methodology Results
Motivation The FAA Cleared The First 3D Printed Part To Fly In A Commercial Jet Engine From GE
Additive Manufacturing Technologies - Gibson et al 8
Reducing the fatigue life of a 3D printed object Motivation: Create delayed damage, so that the object breaks after integration into critical system
o Demonstration of a NEW sabotage attack that targets the fatigue life of a manufactured part in order to damage the system the integrates the part.
o Present and experimentally validate the attack
o Experimental lab and field testing to assess the introduced damage
Use Case: Sabotage of Replacement Propeller via a fatigue attack
Use Case: Sabotage of Replacement Propeller via a fatigue attack
Manipulation The Location of the Defect: Joint connection of the blades to the cap
Iteration through Defects: 0.1 mm gaps best for the time restrains
o Installed a benign and sabotaged propellers on a drone in a lab
o Examined the maximal RPM and time of each
o Replacing the propellers of a drone with AM printed copies.
o Operating the drone under regular conditions
oBreakage after 1:42 minutes of normal operation
Phishing attack Controller PC STL files Insertion of Gaps Faster development of Fatigue time => Destruction of the drone
Yes but Isnt it easy to detect? o The change in weight is less than 3%
o The change in printing time is 1 minute out of 1:17 hours
o Signing your G-code is very limiting
oThe files contain critical manufacturing information that stored only there
oThe files are hard to verify
Automatic search for weak spots: find significantly smaller joint points
Scale up the attack (Cont.) Split printing moves into two, skipping the part that intersects with the gaps
Integrate the script into worm for maximum reach
o Expect to see a lot of research and developments in this field o Opportunity to shape the security in this industry
